A majority of countries in the Nile basin region have low electrification rates
6 . With an expected increase of 50% in the population by 2030
7 and accounting for the well-documented link between electrification and development, the countries have an imperative to improve electricity access and reliability. With a mandate to increase access to electricity, and develop a strategy for the optimum use of energy and financial resources in the region by stimulating cross-border collaboration, an Inter-Governmental Memorandum of Understanding (IGMOU) was signed by ten countries that lie along the Nile River, to form the EAPP.
